para:
When a new object, such as an ℑ or &skel; is created, &oof2; needs to know whether or not to add it to a graphics window. Previous versions of &oof2; had a confusing policy governing which objects would be displayed and when. To avoid confusion, there is now one unambiguous policy:
Nothing is displayed unless you request that it be displayed.

Fortunately, you can change this policy by setting policy in .
Never is the default. New items are not displayed automatically. To add items to a graphics window, use the menu item.
Always is the opposite of Never. New items are always displayed in all graphics windows. Images will be displayed as bitmaps. &skels; and &meshes; will be displayed by their edges. This probably isn't very useful if you have a lot of objects.
Single is the most like the earlier behavior. Objects will be automatically displayed in an existing graphics window if the window doesn't already contain a similar object. Each window can contain one ℑ, one &skel;, and so forth.

Changing the policy from the menu will change it for all new graphics windows, but won't affect windows that are already open. To change the behavior of open windows, use the menu item in the already opened window.
